summary: The Promoting Resilient Buildings Act amends the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to improve building codes and resilience. It defines key terms like "latest published editions" and creates a residential resilience pilot program. This program will provide grants to state and local governments for individuals to retrofit homes against natural disasters, incorporating the latest hazard-resistant designs. The bill mandates a report on the pilot program's effectiveness and limits its applicability to funds appropriated after its enactment. It also clarifies that the Act primarily targets predisaster hazard mitigation and hazard mitigation revolving loan fund programs.
